course.subject: RMBI
course.name: Business Intelligence in Contemporary Society
course.description: Business intelligence is a new discipline that comprises a set of theories, methodologies and processes to analyze business data with the aim of improving an organization's decision making, business planning and projection. The aim of this course is to introduce the general workflow of business intelligence and various applications of data analytics models in business scenarios. The course also focuses on an analysis of the strengths, limitations, causes and impacts of the use of business intelligence. The topics include business intelligence in general, why and how business intelligence systems/tools can facilitate business decision making and improve the profitability of a company. The course also includes hands-on practical exercises by using data mining and statistics models on real business data sets.

reviews.author: 神月 godmoon
reviews.title: Most Lenient grading course in year 1
reviews.comment_content:
Students who have experience in excel VBA will have huge advantages! Co-requisite with COMP 1022Q is highly suggested. Students from Computer Science related majors should find no difficulties in this course.
Contents of lecture:
- Introduction to BI
- Data Modeling and Storage
- Analytics Technologies Enabling BI
- Excel Essentials for Data Analysis
- Optimisation
- Clustering
- Classification
- Market Basket Analysis
- Correlation and Regression
- Time Series Forecasting
- Data Visualization
- Decision tree
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is very kind and responsible. You could even chat in Cantonese with Professor during the class discussion.
好親切，好盡責，秒回Email。
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good grade

Highly recommend registering with math2411 and Comp 1022Q
The content is basically about using excel VBA to do the analytics on the business cases and business model. Students with math and programming backgrounds will have high advantages. ( There will be some content about logic, programming, multiple regression, outlier, decision tree, and clustering.)



Participation:10% 冇出分 但我冇咩點講嘢
Tutorial exercises:20% 19/20 mean 19/20
Pop-up quiz:10%  9 mean 8.5
Assignment 1:20%  20 mean 15.25  highest 20
Assignment 2:20%  17.6 mean 13.82  highest 18.6
Project: 20%   17.3 mean 16.28   highest 18.3
reviews.comment_workload:
Due to the social changes, the final exam is canceled, and assignment 2 is added to the grading rubrics. Assignments + weekly tutorial exercises + discussion preparation = heavy workload.
最後果份assignment 仲要撞final，搞到我只係用左一日做完，可能做多幾日有A+
真係唔知點解有A 教授太好人

reviews.author: pineappleeeeeee
reviews.title: Great Content but a Very Competitive Course.
reviews.comment_content:
Personally, I really love the content, basically it is all about how to use data to achieve business goals.

The content are listed by other reviewers, it's the same throughout the year.

Recommend to attend every lecture. My fav course in my first year journey.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is very kind and happy to answer our question even on the excel one. She is also very enthusiastic in teaching. My fav professor so far.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading are OKAY (not good but not bad). As a first year student, the mean are kinda high as 90% of the class are a 3rd/4th year student which they already understand the content pretty well. The final exam are far harder compare to the content in the class and the exercise given, so I'm not performing really well, got a B range grade.

Take this course if you interested in the content, don't take it for the grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
As a first year student, the workload is quite heavy, need to do 1 tutorial (excel file) and 1 lecture discussion (also excel). Before coming to the class, you also need to watch the whole lecture video, so in the class, you just do the lecture discussion excel file. Each excel file task need around 2-3 hours (the task at the beginning are still easy, but it is getting harder). You need to spend around 4-5 hours to watch lecture and do the whole task per week.

Workload:
Tutorial Excel File,
Lecture Discussion File,
iPRS every lecture.
Writing Essay Assignment
Group Project,
and Final Exam.

As an ambitious first year student, i still can manage the workload, but rmbi1020 is the most high workload course of mine compare to other first year courses. You need to work hard to get the task done perfectly.

reviews.author: bbc9412
reviews.comment_content:
Contents are quite similar to ISOM3360. Involves excel calculation/analysis for each chapter, so it is better to know some basic function like index, match before studying this course. But for some topics like clustering, excel seems to be a bad choice for building the model.

If you have studied ISOM3360 and an Excel course like ISOM3710, this course should be very easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good. Professor is kind and can explain concepts clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lost a few marks in tutorial exercise and participation (iprs question every class).
Only scores of tutorial and participation are released.

I think I did quite well in individual assignment.

For group project, it seems like the professor was not particularly happy with our slides/performance.

Exam contains around 10 questions, involves mostly conceptual question, and some calculation questions. Generally the questions are reasonable, does not requires very good memorization but understanding.
The calculation questions are quite easy, does not involves some very time-consuming and annoying model, like Holt's Winter Forecast.

Got an A range. Grading seems to be quite good.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is relatively heavy. There are tutorial homework (excel) every week. It can take quite a long time to finish if you are familiar with Excel and the concepts.

Individual Assignment contains 4 questions with sub-questions, limited to 6 pages. Basically it is like a long essay, very time consuming.

There is also a group project that you have to choose a topic related to business intelligence.

reviews.author: cryptojet
reviews.title: Crazy workload and Trash grading as a common core course
reviews.comment_content: The contents are great. Yet, the workload is crazy. Most common core courses are chill and easy. This course is very hard
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching are normal. If you do not have fd in this course, you will find that it is very difficult.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is normal but be remembered. The workload is crazy in term of common core.
reviews.comment_workload: Too much excel and tutorial homework. It is basically a machine learning course embedded in Excel. I never expect common core courses to be so overwhelming. This is not a easy course at all

reviews.author: ykllau
reviews.comment_content:
The course is about Business Intelligence.

The topics include basic excel techniques, optimization, clustering, classification, data regression, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The English pronunciation of the professor is not that accurate, sometimes can be hard to understand what she is saying, but can get rid of it after a few lessons.

The powerpoints are in details and many pictures are included.

The lectures are not very useful, but the tutorials are. The professor is patient enough to answer all the questions. I can understand more through the tutorials and through completing the assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very good.

The project and essay mark are quite similar for every classmate.
The exams will be important. I was below mean in the mid-term and have only average results in the final, My project was even below mean. (because the average is quite high in this course)
Despite all the facts mentioned above, I still got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: There is an assignment practising the BI tools every week, not complicated and there are detailed guidelines. It can be completed if I attend the tutorial.

reviews.author: Vongola ·Wu
reviews.comment_content: She will tell you some interesting knowledge about the BI and how to use excel to analyze some data.
reviews.comment_teaching:
interesting and easy to understand.
in the tutorial classes, she will teach you how to use the Excel to finish some functions.
reviews.comment_grading:
b+
because there will be so many year 4 and RMBI students who have known a lot of knowledge.
reviews.comment_workload: for year 1 students, this course needs you to do a presentation and write some reports. so for year 1 students, the workload is a little heavy. but it can be overcome.

reviews.author: mnmsing
reviews.title: Good grading!!
reviews.comment_content:
Business intelligence is a new discipline that comprises a set of theories, methodologies and processes to analyze business data with the aim of improving an organization’s decision making, business planning and projection. The aim of this course is to introduce the business intelligence
principles, various types of data analytics techniques, and discuss the effects of various social problems on the use of business intelligence. The course also focuses on an analysis of the strengths, limitations, and impacts of the use of business intelligence. The topics include business intelligence strategies, the power of social influence, data collection and management, confidentiality and privacy issues, and organizational and human behavioral changes. Also included are case studies of real business data analysis problems by employing data mining tools.

1. Introduction to Business Intelligence
2. Data Modeling and Storage
3. Analytics Technologies Enabling Business
Intelligence
4. Excel Essentials for Business Data Analysis
5. Business Data Analytics – Optimization
6. Business Data Analytics – Clustering
7. Business Data Analytics – Classification
8. Business Data Analytics – Market Basket
Analysis
9. Business Data Analytics – Correlation and
Regression
10. Business Data Analytics – Time Series
Forecasting
11. Data Visualization

Most topics include hands-on.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Jean WANG is a professor who teaches with heart. She would provide a lot of real-life cases to help you to understand the topics taught. Her notes were enough for midterm and final.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading!

Lenient when marking midterm and final.

Tutorial Exercises (10%)
Assignment 1 (10%)
Midterm Test (20%)
Assignment (20%)
Examination (40%)

Above mean for both midterm and final and both assignments. Got an A at last ~
reviews.comment_workload:
Do not have a heavy workload.

1. Submit a tutorial file every week.
2. Assignment 1 -- Summary writing
3. Assignment 2 -- Group Project and Presentation

One midterm and one final.

reviews.author: tlong
reviews.title: Great in all aspects
reviews.comment_content: Aspiring. The lecture covers a wide range of content and teaches us how to convert raw information into some business insights through clustering, classification, regression and different real-world methods with the aid of excel.
reviews.comment_teaching: Excellent. Professor Wang encourages us to rethink and ask questions, and provide great answers to our queries.  Full support in tutorial sessions, understanding the error we have made and how to improve the solution.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good. As long as you have look through the lecture notes.
Tutorial HW (10%):
A total of 11 tutorial exercise. One of it as bonus points. Full mark as long as you attend the tutorial session
10/10
Assg 1 (10%) Individual work. Write an essay base on questions given by lecturer.
83/100 Mean: 70.5
Assg 2 (20%) Group work. Complete a presentation on suggested topics (You can propose a new one, no effects on grade)
82/100 Mean: 80.3
Midterm (20%) Exact wording not required. Showing understanding of the topic could reward you with a point. Fine if you have read the powerpoints and remember most of the content.
87/100 Mean: 73.1 SD: ~16 (Forget the exact figures)
Final (40%) Slightly hard then mid-term. Grades not returned, so don't know how well I perform.

Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much.
Assg 1: Work earlier on assignment will be better. I started that one day ago and turn out unable to complete the last part of one question
Assg 2: Communication between the other group mate is not that good. Our work isn't cohesive. Ends up not that satisfying.
Midterm or Final: Spend one or two days if you are aiming an "A"

Attendance is not a must. But professor's lesson is interesting, strongly recommend to attend the lessons.

reviews.author: Dragos
reviews.title: Easy course. Do not need to memorize
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite interesting, which is about methods of modeling data and how those data can be used for business purposes in contemporary society (Many examples are given in the lectures and there are practices in the tutorials for better understanding). In my opinion, you can know more about how data work in real life and make life better after the course. There are links to the reading materials in the powerpoint but it is optional. Read them if you are interested in them.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is willing to answer your questions patiently and care about whether students could understand the content. Also, she truly hopes that students can learn from the courses so she examines students' understanding instead of memorization.
reviews.comment_grading:
Should be easy to understand the content and get a good grade if you pay attention in the lectures although it may be quite boring for the earlier ones.
                                                 Weighting      
Tutorials homework:                    10%             (10/10)      
Assignment 1(individual):            10%             (90/100)  mean: 70.5
Assignment 2(Group):                 20%             (85/100)  mean: 80.3
Mid-term :                                    20%             (89/100)  mean: 71.2
Final:                                            40%             will not be returned

Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Compare to other courses, the workload is heavier, which there is 1 tutorial assignment each week ( you can complete them during the tutorial section where clear steps are given to you, should be easy to get full marks). I usually spent more time to understand the whole algorithm though but I think it worthed my time (for the mid-term and final).
Also, there are 2 assignments. 1 individual ( search on the internet) and 1 group presentation/project (2-3ppl), which is quite hard to get great marks much higher than the mean unless you are really good at presentation (case studies, good data visualization). Better to have someone to study the course with you for the project. p.s. got carried by higher years students.
Moreover, the first tutorial requires you to form a group for a very small presentation which counts for one bonus mark for the tutorial(actually it does not affect much to the grade).

reviews.author: I.048S96
reviews.title: Great Introductory Course and Great Professor
reviews.comment_content:
I loved the content. I am not a business student but I was very much intrigued by the things taught in this course.

Contents of lecture:
- Data Modeling and Storage
- Analytics Technologies Enabling BI
- Excel Essentials for Data Analysis
- Optimisation
- Clustering
- Classification
- Market Basket Analysis
- Correlation and Regression
- Time Series Forecasting
- Big Data and BI
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching, I am not very certain. You don't need to be there for the lectures, just look over the presentations and that will probably be the same as going to lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is great. But I think those who are good at writing and speaking English are at an advantage. There are presentations that require speaking and assignments that require writing (both in English).

If you are not comfortable with any of the two, you should probably take another course.

Midterms and Finals... The professor insists you should not memorize everything. But I advise you to MEMORIZE EVERYTHING. Otherwise you will have a hard time during the exams.

Plus, it helps if you are proficient in Excel. Many students have a hard time doing labs with Excel. They are not very hard but sometimes they do get a little tricky.

Midterm: 92/100
Final: Not Out Yet (I don't know why) Around 95 I am hoping
Assignment: 98 (Research paper), 92 (Presentation, Project)
Labs: Most of the students get full mark.
Participation: Not Out Yet (Probably free score...?)
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload.
One lab every week that takes up to two hours... If you get lost, it will take up a lot of time.
Assignment takes around 5 hours. You need to write reports after doing research. All you need to work on is delivery and content (which could be hard to some people) But she doesn't hit you in the back with a terrible score if you invest adequate time and effort into it.
Studying for the exams should take you some time since you should be memorizing everything on the slides. If you memorize everything I think you can get an A, even an A+.

reviews.author: ggng
reviews.title: Amazing course and amazing grade
reviews.comment_content:
Content is rich. The course covers the whole business process of BI, from data storage(Access, OLAP, Hadoop), data analysis (data mining algorithms) to visualisation. Although this is an introductory course,  there are many hands-on techniques taught in tutorials about how to do analysis, which are very insightful to students interested in data analytics. There is a group project to submit at the end of semester. We can select the titles given or suggest a new one.

Contents of lecture:
- Introduction to BI
- Data Modeling and Storage
- Analytics Technologies Enabling BI
- Excel Essentials for Data Analysis
- Optimisation
- Clustering
- Classification
- Market Basket Analysis
- Correlation and Regression
- Time Series Forecasting
- Data Visualization
- Big Data and BI
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wang is very passionate to teach us. She is a nice person and very keen to help if I have any questions. She is one of the best professor I've met in UST.

Lecture notes and tutorials are very helpful, I recommend you to attend every lecture and tutorials because they are too good to be missed!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is extremely good, compare to other common core courses. I think if professor knows you have put effort in your work, she will give good marks to you. I once uploaded wrong file for tutorial assignment, she just asked me to upload again a few days after deadline and my marks were not deducted. :) She's so nice.

Assessment and Weightings:
– Individual Assignment (including class participation+tutorial assignments): 20%
– End‐Term Group Project: 20%
– Mid‐Term Test: 20%
– Final Exam: 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
- Tutorial assignment
The 20% individual points come from tutorial assignment. There is very clear instructions in the tutorial notes and it is easy to get full marks if you follow the guideline. You can ask professor during tutorial if you have any questions.

- Mid term and final exam
Exams are not hard. Do not need to memorise everything and very little calculation involved(do not even need calculator lol). Only need to go though notes twice or three times and understand the concept.

- Group project
I put a looooooot of effort in group presentation and report. I kind of regret putting so much time on it because professor may not expect that much (cause this is an intro course). As long as you have great teammates, I think this group project is not hard to get full marks. lol

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.comment_content: Introduce business intelligence. Identify business intelligence used in different cases. The pros and cons for using business intelligence.
reviews.comment_teaching: "World Class" pronunciation from instructor so student may need time to understand the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 20%
Group Project 20%
Midterm 20%
Final 40%

The mean grade for this course is B.
reviews.comment_workload: The course requires reading every week and those readings are more than 10 pages. It takes me a long time to finish reading it. We are required to present every tutorial and thus a bit high work load. Mid term and Final are open book.

reviews.author: Danny_
reviews.comment_content: The content is very simple. Contents are repetitive through the course, mainly about the advantage, disadvantage and the use of different Business Intelligence tools, such as OLAP, Data Mining etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: During tutorial, we are divided into groups mainly doing presentation on different BI issues. Dr Lau would like us to learn the presentation skills mainly in the tutorial. Dr Lau usually using the same example in discussing the BI issues. This makes us more memorable.
reviews.comment_grading: The Grading is very good, given that the work load is not large.
reviews.comment_workload:
For tutorial, we have to prepare for a small presentation. It is relatively easy. It takes you 2 hours at most in preparing for it, mainly looking for extra information in responding the questions given by Dr Lau.

For Mid-term and Final, it would be a open notes and open book exam. It's also very easy. You just have to take 2 hours to go through the lecture notes and the tutorial material once, and you can manage the exam. Dr Lau would also provide some sample exam paper for us go study, so that we can fully familiar with the exam format.

A relative large presentation is also carried out. But this is not a large workload as it is a group project. Generally, each group member has to prepare 2 short points for the presentation, and that's it

reviews.author: BBC
reviews.title: Quite boring teaching
reviews.comment_content: The content is supposed to be important as it is about big data and business intelligence. The powerpoints however is quite difficult to understand, it should be better if she can just use simple language to express whatever she want us to learn.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite boring in fact, most students are just playing smartphones.
reviews.comment_grading: As I have dropped the class in early stages I am not certain about the grading but be prepared to make a presentation in your first tutorial class.
reviews.comment_workload: It might be quite difficult to handle if you want to get a good grade, she would quiz about things that is not in the powerpoint on the one hand, but it is really difficult to keep being sober in the class on the other hand.
